message.content:
Make install should setup python, install dependencies, install jupyter, and       
  let the user add the keys to huggingface and claude. The notebooks folder          
  should exist anyway as we will be adding notebooks later. Make start should        
  then fire up the jupyter server, and open jupyter in a browser. make stop          
  should shut everything down.

content.thinking: Let me look at the existing files to understand the current structure before making changes.

content.text: Let me look at the existing files first.

content.content:
1→# ── Defaults (override on the command line) ───────────────────────────────────
     2→PROVIDER     ?= claude
     3→MODEL        ?= claude-opus-4-6
     4→URL          ?=
     5→JUPYTER_PORT ?= 8888
     6→
     7→# Prepend .venv/bin when it exists (created on macOS by make setup).
     8→# All targets that invoke Python tools pick up venv binaries automatically.
     9→VENV_BIN := $(shell [ -d .venv ] && echo "$(PWD)/.venv/bin:" || echo "")
    10→export PATH := $(VENV_BIN)$(PATH)
    11→
    12→.PHONY: help install start stop cli setup
    13→
    14→.DEFAULT_GOAL := help
    15→
    16→# ── help ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    17→help:
    18→	@echo ""
    19→	@echo "Usage:"
    20→	@echo "  make install                       Install Python dependencies"
    21→	@echo "  make start                         Start Jupyter Notebook (creates .env if missing)"
    22→	@echo "  make stop                          Stop the Jupyter Notebook server"
    23→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://...           Generate a Python CLI from a docs URL"
    24→	@echo ""
    25→	@echo "Parameters for make cli (with defaults):"
    26→	@echo "  PROVIDER=$(PROVIDER)   claude | hf"
    27→	@echo "  MODEL=$(MODEL)"
    28→	@echo "  URL=$(URL)"
    29→	@echo "  JUPYTER_PORT=$(JUPYTER_PORT)"
    30→	@echo ""
    31→	@echo "Examples:"
    32→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://docs.anthropic.com/en/api/messages"
    33→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://huggingface.co/docs/hub/api PROVIDER=hf MODEL=mistralai/Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.3"
    34→	@echo ""
    35→
    36→# ── install ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    37→## Install Python dependencies (uses .venv on macOS, system pip elsewhere).
    38→install:
    39→	pip install -r requirements.txt
    40→
    41→# ── start ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    42→## Fire up Jupyter Notebook (prompts for API keys when .env is missing).
    43→## Press Ctrl+C or run `make stop` (from another terminal) to shut down.
    44→start: setup
    45→	jupyter notebook notebooks/generate_cli.ipynb --port $(JUPYTER_PORT)
    46→
    47→# ── stop ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    48→## Shut down the Jupyter Notebook server.
    49→stop:
    50→	@jupyter notebook stop $(JUPYTER_PORT) 2>/dev/null \
    51→	  && echo "Jupyter stopped on port $(JUPYTER_PORT)." \
    52→	  || { pkill -f "jupyter.*notebook" 2>/dev/null \
    53→	         && echo "Jupyter process killed." \
    54→	         || echo "No Jupyter server found on port $(JUPYTER_PORT)."; }
    55→
    56→# ── cli ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    57→## Generate a Python CLI tool from a documentation URL.
    58→## Usage: make cli URL=https://... [PROVIDER=claude|hf] [MODEL=model-name]
    59→cli: setup
    60→ifndef URL
    61→	$(error URL is required. Usage: make cli URL=https://... [PROVIDER=claude|hf] [MODEL=model-name])
    62→endif
    63→	@echo ""
    64→	@echo "Provider : $(PROVIDER)"
    65→	@echo "Model    : $(MODEL)"
    66→	@echo "URL      : $(URL)"
    67→	@echo ""
    68→	@set -a && . ./.env && set +a && \
    69→	  PROVIDER=$(PROVIDER) MODEL=$(MODEL) URL=$(URL) \
    70→	  papermill notebooks/generate_cli.ipynb \
    71→	    /tmp/cli_out_$$(date +%s).ipynb \
    72→	    -p PROVIDER "$(PROVIDER)" \
    73→	    -p MODEL    "$(MODEL)" \
    74→	    -p URL      "$(URL)"
    75→
    76→# ── setup (internal) ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    77→## Create .env with API keys. Skipped silently when .env already exists.
    78→setup:
    79→	@chmod +x scripts/setup.sh
    80→	@bash scripts/setup.sh
    81→

# Copy this file to .env and fill in your keys.
# Never commit .env — it is gitignored.

# HuggingFace access token (https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens)
HF_TOKEN=hf_...

# Anthropic API key (https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys)
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=sk-ant-...

# Default provider and model (can be overridden on the make cli command line)
# PROVIDER: "claude" | "hf"
PROVIDER=claude
# Claude models: claude-opus-4-6 | claude-sonnet-4-6 | claude-haiku-4-5-20251001
# HF models   : mistralai/Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.3 | meta-llama/Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct
MODEL=claude-opus-4-6

file.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Full first-time setup:
#   1. Verify Python 3.9+
#   2. Create a virtualenv on macOS
#   3. Install pip dependencies if any are missing
#   4. Prompt for API keys (skipped when .env already exists)
set -e

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
REPO_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"

# ── 1. Python check ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
PYTHON_BIN=""
for cmd in python3 python; do
  if command -v "$cmd" &>/dev/null; then
    ver=$("$cmd" -c "import sys; print(f'{sys.version_info.major}.{sys.version_info.minor}')" 2>/dev/null || true)
    major="${ver%%.*}"
    minor="${ver##*.}"
    if [ "${major:-0}" -ge 3 ] && [ "${minor:-0}" -ge 9 ]; then
      PYTHON_BIN="$cmd"
      break
    fi
  fi
done

if [ -z "$PYTHON_BIN" ]; then
  echo ""
  echo "Error: Python 3.9+ is required but not found."
  echo "  Install it from https://www.python.org/downloads/"
  exit 1
fi

echo "Python : $($PYTHON_BIN --version)"

# ── 2. macOS: create virtualenv ───────────────────────────────────────────────
OS="$(uname -s)"
VENV_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/.venv"
PIP_BIN="$(command -v pip3 || command -v pip || echo pip)"

if [ "$OS" = "Darwin" ]; then
  echo "macOS  : detected"
  if [ ! -d "$VENV_DIR" ]; then
    echo "venv   : creating at .venv …"
    "$PYTHON_BIN" -m venv "$VENV_DIR"
    echo "venv   : created"
  else
    echo "venv   : .venv already exists"
  fi
  PYTHON_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/python"
  PIP_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/pip"
fi

# ── 3. Install pip dependencies if any package is missing ─────────────────────
REQUIREMENTS="$REPO_ROOT/requirements.txt"
MISSING=0

# Module names as imported in Python (may differ from package names in requirements.txt)
for mod in notebook papermill anthropic huggingface_hub requests bs4 dotenv; do
  if ! "$PYTHON_BIN" -c "import $mod" 2>/dev/null; then
    MISSING=1
    break
  fi
done

if [ "$MISSING" -eq 1 ]; then
  echo "deps   : installing from requirements.txt …"
  "$PIP_BIN" install -r "$REQUIREMENTS" --quiet
  echo "deps   : installed"
else
  echo "deps   : all packages already installed"
fi

# ── 4. API key setup (skipped when .env already exists) ───────────────────────
ENV_FILE="$REPO_ROOT/.env"

if [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
  echo ".env   : exists — skipping key setup (edit manually to update keys)"
  exit 0
fi

echo ""
echo "┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐"
echo "│  First-time setup: configure your API keys           │"
echo "│  Keys are stored in .env (gitignored).               │"
echo "└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘"
echo ""

printf "HuggingFace token  (https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens)  [Enter to skip]: "
read -r HF_TOKEN

printf "Anthropic API key  (https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys) [Enter to skip]: "
read -r ANTHROPIC_API_KEY

cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Auto-generated by make start — edit freely.
HF_TOKEN=${HF_TOKEN}
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=${ANTHROPIC_API_KEY}

# Default provider and model (overridable via make cli PROVIDER=... MODEL=...)
PROVIDER=claude
MODEL=claude-opus-4-6
EOF

echo ""
echo ".env   : created. You're all set!"

content.thinking:
Now I understand the current setup. The user wants:

1. `make install` should:
   - Setup Python (check version, create venv)
   - Install dependencies
   - Install Jupyter
   - Let user add keys to HuggingFace and Claude
   - The notebooks folder should exist (create if it doesn't)

2. `make start` should:
   - Fire up the Jupyter server
   - Open Jupyter in a browser

3. `make stop` should:
   - Shut everything down

Currently:
- `make install` just does `pip install -r requirements.txt` (no venv, no key setup)


- `make start` is calling a setup target first, then launching Jupyter on a specific notebook
- `make stop` shuts down Jupyter

So I need to consolidate the setup logic into the install target and strip start down to just launching the server and opening the browser.

For the browser part, Jupyter normally opens one automatically by default, but since we're running it in the background to return control to the terminal, I'll need to handle that explicitly—either by using the `--browser` flag or by manually opening it after the server starts. 3. Return control to the terminal (so you can later run `make stop`)

Currently, `make start` runs `jupyter notebook` in the foreground, which blocks the terminal. For a proper start/stop workflow, we should run it in the background.

Let me design the solution:

**`make install`**:
- Run `setup.sh` (handles: python check, venv creation, deps installation, notebooks dir creation, key prompting)
- Create notebooks dir if it doesn't exist

**`make start`**:
- Check .env exists (if not, prompt user to run `make install`)
- Start Jupyter in the background, write PID to .jupyter.pid, log to .jupyter.log
- Open browser automatically (Jupyter does this by default, or use `open` on macOS)

**`make stop`**:
- Kill the Jupyter server using the PID from .jupyter.pid, with pkill as a fallback

Now I need to update the setup script and Makefile. For the start target, I'll launch Jupyter in the background while capturing its output and PID, then handle browser opening separately. The stop target will read that PID file to cleanly shut down the server. I'm working through the Makefile implementation for starting Jupyter. I need to handle the browser opening cross-platform—using `open` on macOS and `xdg-open` on Linux—so I'll chain them together with a fallback approach to ensure it works regardless of the system. Writing the Makefile and setup scripts... I need to update `setup.sh` to create the notebooks directory with a message, then adjust the Makefile targets—removing or internalizing `setup`, updating `.PHONY` and help text, and making `cli` depend on `.env` instead of `setup` since Jupyter installation is already handled by the requirements file.

For the `start` target, I'll change it to open the root Jupyter page rather than a specific notebook, and for `stop`, I'll implement a multi-method approach using `jupyter notebook stop` as the primary method with fallbacks to the PID file and pkill.

Writing the Makefile updates... Finishing up the stop target logic, then I'll write out the setup script with the notebooks directory creation added to the initialization sequence.

content.text:
Now I have a clear picture. The current `make install` only runs `pip install`, while `setup` (called by `start`) does the heavy lifting. I'll reorganize so:
- `install` = full setup (python, venv, deps, notebooks dir, key prompting)
- `start` = source `.env`, launch Jupyter in background, open browser
- `stop` = kill the server cleanly via PID file

Let me update both files.

if [ ! -d "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR"
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ created"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Full first-time setup:
#   1. Verify Python 3.9+
#   2. Create a virtualenv on macOS
#   3. Install pip dependencies if any are missing
#   4. Prompt for API keys (skipped when .env already exists)
set -e

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
REPO_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"

# ── 1. Python check ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
PYTHON_BIN=""
for cmd in python3 python; do
  if command -v "$cmd" &>/dev/null; then
    ver=$("$cmd" -c "import sys; print(f'{sys.version_info.major}.{sys.version_info.minor}')" 2>/dev/null || true)
    major="${ver%%.*}"
    minor="${ver##*.}"
    if [ "${major:-0}" -ge 3 ] && [ "${minor:-0}" -ge 9 ]; then
      PYTHON_BIN="$cmd"
      break
    fi
  fi
done

if [ -z "$PYTHON_BIN" ]; then
  echo ""
  echo "Error: Python 3.9+ is required but not found."
  echo "  Install it from https://www.python.org/downloads/"
  exit 1
fi

echo "Python : $($PYTHON_BIN --version)"

# ── 2. macOS: create virtualenv ───────────────────────────────────────────────
OS="$(uname -s)"
VENV_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/.venv"
PIP_BIN="$(command -v pip3 || command -v pip || echo pip)"

if [ "$OS" = "Darwin" ]; then
  echo "macOS  : detected"
  if [ ! -d "$VENV_DIR" ]; then
    echo "venv   : creating at .venv …"
    "$PYTHON_BIN" -m venv "$VENV_DIR"
    echo "venv   : created"
  else
    echo "venv   : .venv already exists"
  fi
  PYTHON_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/python"
  PIP_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/pip"
fi

# ── 3. Install pip dependencies if any package is missing ─────────────────────
REQUIREMENTS="$REPO_ROOT/requirements.txt"
MISSING=0

# Module names as imported in Python (may differ from package names in requirements.txt)
for mod in notebook papermill anthropic huggingface_hub requests bs4 dotenv; do
  if ! "$PYTHON_BIN" -c "import $mod" 2>/dev/null; then
    MISSING=1
    break
  fi
done

if [ "$MISSING" -eq 1 ]; then
  echo "deps   : installing from requirements.txt …"
  "$PIP_BIN" install -r "$REQUIREMENTS" --quiet
  echo "deps   : installed"
else
  echo "deps   : all packages already installed"
fi

# ── 4. API key setup (skipped when .env already exists) ───────────────────────
ENV_FILE="$REPO_ROOT/.env"

if [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
  echo ".env   : exists — skipping key setup (edit manually to update keys)"
  exit 0
fi

echo ""
echo "┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐"
echo "│  First-time setup: configure your API keys           │"
echo "│  Keys are stored in .env (gitignored).               │"
echo "└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘"
echo ""

printf "HuggingFace token  (https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens)  [Enter to skip]: "
read -r HF_TOKEN

printf "Anthropic API key  (https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys) [Enter to skip]: "
read -r ANTHROPIC_API_KEY

cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Auto-generated by make start — edit freely.
HF_TOKEN=${HF_TOKEN}
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=${ANTHROPIC_API_KEY}

# Default provider and model (overridable via make cli PROVIDER=... MODEL=...)
PROVIDER=claude
MODEL=claude-opus-4-6
EOF

echo ""
echo ".env   : created. You're all set!"

1→# ── Defaults (override on the command line) ───────────────────────────────────
     2→PROVIDER     ?= claude
     3→MODEL        ?= claude-opus-4-6

     9→VENV_BIN := $(shell [ -d .venv ] && echo "$(PWD)/.venv/bin:" || echo "")
    10→export PATH := $(VENV_BIN)$(PATH)
    11→
    12→.PHONY: help install start stop cli
    13→
    14→.DEFAULT_GOAL := help
    15→
    16→# ── help ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    17→help:
    18→	@echo ""
    19→	@echo "Usage:"
    20→	@echo "  make install                       Set up Python, install deps, configure API keys"
    21→	@echo "  make start                         Start Jupyter and open it in the browser"
    22→	@echo "  make stop                          Stop the Jupyter server"
    23→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://...           Generate a Python CLI from a docs URL"
    24→	@echo ""

    26→	@echo "  PROVIDER=$(PROVIDER)   claude | hf"
    27→	@echo "  MODEL=$(MODEL)"
    28→	@echo "  URL=$(URL)"
    29→	@echo "  JUPYTER_PORT=$(JUPYTER_PORT)"
    30→	@echo ""
    31→	@echo "Examples:"
    32→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://docs.anthropic.com/en/api/messages"
    33→	@echo "  make cli URL=https://huggingface.co/docs/hub/api PROVIDER=hf MODEL=mistralai/Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.3"
    34→	@echo ""
    35→
    36→# ── install ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    37→## Check Python, create venv, install dependencies + Jupyter, create notebooks/,
    38→## and prompt for HuggingFace / Anthropic API keys (skipped when .env exists).
    39→install:
    40→	@chmod +x scripts/setup.sh
    41→	@bash scripts/setup.sh
    42→	@echo ""
    43→	@echo "All done. Run 'make start' to launch Jupyter."
    44→
    45→# ── start ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    46→## Launch Jupyter in the background and open it in your default browser.
    47→start:
    48→	@[ -f .env ] || { echo "Run 'make install' first to install dependencies and configure API keys."; exit 1; }
    49→	@mkdir -p notebooks
    50→	@set -a && . ./.env && set +a && \
    51→	  nohup jupyter notebook --port $(JUPYTER_PORT) > .jupyter.log 2>&1 & echo $$! > .jupyter.pid
    52→	@echo "Jupyter starting on port $(JUPYTER_PORT) … (log: .jupyter.log)"
    53→	@sleep 2
    54→	@open http://localhost:$(JUPYTER_PORT) 2>/dev/null || \
    55→	  xdg-open http://localhost:$(JUPYTER_PORT) 2>/dev/null || \
    56→	  echo "Open http://localhost:$(JUPYTER_PORT) in your browser."
    57→
    58→# ── stop ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    59→## Stop the Jupyter server.
    60→stop:
    61→	@PID=""; \
    62→	[ -f .jupyter.pid ] && PID=$$(cat .jupyter.pid); \
    63→	if [ -n "$$PID" ] && kill "$$PID" 2>/dev/null; then \
    64→	  echo "Jupyter stopped (PID $$PID)."; rm -f .jupyter.pid; \
    65→	elif pkill -f "jupyter.*notebook" 2>/dev/null; then \
    66→	  echo "Jupyter process killed."; rm -f .jupyter.pid; \
    67→	else \
    68→	  echo "No Jupyter server found."; \
    69→	fi
    70→
    71→# ── cli ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    72→## Generate a Python CLI tool from a documentation URL.
    73→## Usage: make cli URL=https://... [PROVIDER=claude|hf] [MODEL=model-name]
    74→cli:
    75→	@[ -f .env ] || { echo "Run 'make install' first to install dependencies and configure API keys."; exit 1; }
    76→ifndef URL
    77→	$(error URL is required. Usage: make cli URL=https://... [PROVIDER=claude|hf] [MODEL=model-name])
    78→endif
    79→	@echo ""
    80→	@echo "Provider : $(PROVIDER)"
    81→	@echo "Model    : $(MODEL)"
    82→	@echo "URL      : $(URL)"
    83→	@echo ""
    84→	@set -a && . ./.env && set +a && \
    85→	  PROVIDER=$(PROVIDER) MODEL=$(MODEL) URL=$(URL) \
    86→	  papermill notebooks/generate_cli.ipynb \
    87→	    /tmp/cli_out_$$(date +%s).ipynb \
    88→	    -p PROVIDER "$(PROVIDER)" \
    89→	    -p MODEL    "$(MODEL)" \
    90→	    -p URL      "$(URL)"
    91→

file.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Full first-time setup:
#   1. Verify Python 3.9+
#   2. Create a virtualenv on macOS
#   3. Install pip dependencies if any are missing
#   4. Prompt for API keys (skipped when .env already exists)
set -e

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
REPO_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"

# ── 1. Python check ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
PYTHON_BIN=""
for cmd in python3 python; do
  if command -v "$cmd" &>/dev/null; then
    ver=$("$cmd" -c "import sys; print(f'{sys.version_info.major}.{sys.version_info.minor}')" 2>/dev/null || true)
    major="${ver%%.*}"
    minor="${ver##*.}"
    if [ "${major:-0}" -ge 3 ] && [ "${minor:-0}" -ge 9 ]; then
      PYTHON_BIN="$cmd"
      break
    fi
  fi
done

if [ -z "$PYTHON_BIN" ]; then
  echo ""
  echo "Error: Python 3.9+ is required but not found."
  echo "  Install it from https://www.python.org/downloads/"
  exit 1
fi

echo "Python : $($PYTHON_BIN --version)"

# ── 2. macOS: create virtualenv ───────────────────────────────────────────────
OS="$(uname -s)"
VENV_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/.venv"
PIP_BIN="$(command -v pip3 || command -v pip || echo pip)"

if [ "$OS" = "Darwin" ]; then
  echo "macOS  : detected"
  if [ ! -d "$VENV_DIR" ]; then
    echo "venv   : creating at .venv …"
    "$PYTHON_BIN" -m venv "$VENV_DIR"
    echo "venv   : created"
  else
    echo "venv   : .venv already exists"
  fi
  PYTHON_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/python"
  PIP_BIN="$VENV_DIR/bin/pip"
fi

# ── 3. Install pip dependencies if any package is missing ─────────────────────
REQUIREMENTS="$REPO_ROOT/requirements.txt"
MISSING=0

# Module names as imported in Python (may differ from package names in requirements.txt)
for mod in notebook papermill anthropic huggingface_hub requests bs4 dotenv; do
  if ! "$PYTHON_BIN" -c "import $mod" 2>/dev/null; then
    MISSING=1
    break
  fi
done

if [ "$MISSING" -eq 1 ]; then
  echo "deps   : installing from requirements.txt …"
  "$PIP_BIN" install -r "$REQUIREMENTS" --quiet
  echo "deps   : installed"
else
  echo "deps   : all packages already installed"
fi

# ── 4. Ensure notebooks directory exists ──────────────────────────────────────
NOTEBOOKS_DIR="$REPO_ROOT/notebooks"
if [ ! -d "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$NOTEBOOKS_DIR"
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ created"
else
  echo "dir    : notebooks/ already exists"
fi

# ── 5. API key setup (skipped when .env already exists) ───────────────────────
ENV_FILE="$REPO_ROOT/.env"

if [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
  echo ".env   : exists — skipping key setup (edit manually to update keys)"
  exit 0
fi

echo ""
echo "┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐"
echo "│  First-time setup: configure your API keys           │"
echo "│  Keys are stored in .env (gitignored).               │"
echo "└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘"
echo ""

printf "HuggingFace token  (https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens)  [Enter to skip]: "
read -r HF_TOKEN

printf "Anthropic API key  (https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys) [Enter to skip]: "
read -r ANTHROPIC_API_KEY

cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Auto-generated by make start — edit freely.
HF_TOKEN=${HF_TOKEN}
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=${ANTHROPIC_API_KEY}

# Default provider and model (overridable via make cli PROVIDER=... MODEL=...)
PROVIDER=claude
MODEL=claude-opus-4-6
EOF

echo ""
echo ".env   : created. You're all set!"

content.text:
Everything looks good. Here's a summary of what changed:

**`Makefile`**
- `install` now calls `setup.sh` (which handles Python check, venv, deps, notebooks dir, key prompting) — the old bare `pip install` is replaced with the full setup flow
- `start` no longer runs setup; it checks `.env` exists, launches `jupyter notebook` in the background via `nohup`, writes the PID to `.jupyter.pid`, then opens `http://localhost:8888` in your browser (`open` on macOS, `xdg-open` on Linux)
- `stop` uses the PID file first, falls back to `pkill`, cleans up `.jupyter.pid`
- Removed the internal `setup` target — its logic now lives entirely in `install`

**`scripts/setup.sh`**
- Added step 4: creates `notebooks/` if it doesn't exist (before prompting for API keys)

**Workflow:**
```
make install   # first time only — sets up everything + prompts for keys
make start     # starts Jupyter in background, opens browser
make stop      # kills the server
```
